Event.0: Portuguese filmmaker Manoel de Oliveira, who was known for richly meditative and often self-reflexive films that were frequently inspired by literary and theatrical works, died at age 106.
Event.1: "Wayne's World" actress Tia Carrere (43) divorces British photojournalist Simon Wakelin due to irreconcilable differences after 7 years of marriage
Event.2:
Death of Pope John Paul II
The bishop of Rome and the head of the Roman Catholic Church from 1978, Pope John Paul II, who was the first non-Italian pope in 455 years and the first from a Slavic country, died in Vatican City this day in 2005.
Event.3: Canadian Prime Minister Pierre Trudeau (64) divorces Margaret Sinclair née Sinclair (35) due to irreconcilable differences after 13 years of marriage
Event.4: Argentine troops seized the Falkland Islands (Islas Malvinas), precipitating the Falkland Islands War with Britain.
Event.5: Several thousand Argentine troops seize the Falkland (Malvinas) Islands from Great Britain
Event.6: Fleetwood Mac's "Rumours" album goes #1 & stays #1 for 31 weeks
Event.8: Stanley Kubrick's 2001: A Space Odyssey had its world premiere in Washington, D.C.; it became a classic, setting the benchmark for sci-fi films.
Event.9: "2001 A Space Odyssey" directed by Stanley Kubrick and starring Keir Dullea and Gary Lockwood, premieres at the Uptown Theater in Washington, D.C.
Event.10:
Rodney Glen King
American construction worker
was born
Event.11:
Camille Paglia
American academic
was born
Event.12: Author Jacqueline Susann (20) weds Irving Mansfield at Har Zion Temple in Philadelphia
Event.13:
Marvin Gaye
American singer and composer
was born
Event.14: Ras Tafari Makonnen becomes Emperor Haile Selassie of Abyssinia (Ethiopia)
Event.15: Lawyer Hans Frank (24) weds secretary Brigitte Herbst (29) in Munich, Germany
Event.16: Heavyweight boxing champ Jack Dempsey (23) divorces Maxine Gates after 2 years of marriage
Event.17: US President Woodrow Wilson asks Congress to declare war against Germany
Event.18: U.S. President Woodrow Wilson asked Congress for a declaration of war against Germany.
Event.19:
Sir Alec Guinness
British actor
was born
Event.20: British actor Sir Alec Guinness was born.
Event.21: German sculptor and painter Max Ernst, who was a leading advocate of irrationality in art, was born.
Event.22: In the face of advancing Union forces, Confederate troops evacuated Richmond, Virginia, the capital of the Confederate States of America during the American Civil War.
Event.23: English novelist and social critic Charles Dickens (24) marries Catherine Thomson Hogarth (20)
Event.24:
Hans Christian Andersen
Danish author
was born
Event.25: Napoleonic Wars: The British led by Horatio Nelson destroy the Danish fleet in the naval Battle of Copenhagen
Event.26: The Coinage Act is passed establishing the United States Mint and authorizing the $10 Eagle, $5 half-Eagle & 2.50 quarter-Eagle gold coins & silver dollar, ½ dollar, quarter, dime & half-dime
Event.27: King Charles II of England officially proclaimed the charter he had granted in March to William Penn for the Quaker colony of Pennsylvania in North America.
Event.28: Spanish explorer Juan Ponce de León landed on the coast of Florida.
Event.29: Explorer Juan Ponce de León claims Florida for Spain as the first known European to reach Florida
Event.30: Mehmed II begins his siege of Constantinople (İstanbul), which falls May 29
